sentences.en: abide by the rules; had to abide by the judge's decision.
sentences.cn: 遵守条律；服从法官的判决

sentences.en: Above all, everyone must abide by the law.
sentences.cn: 首要的是，每个人都必须遵守法律。

sentences.en: At last luck seemed to settle and abide with Joe.
sentences.cn: 后来乔好像非常走运.

sentences.en: For goodness'sakes, Lucy Marian, speak up! I can't abide children who mumble.
sentences.cn: 乖乖! 露西?玛丽安, 讲大声一点! 我最讨厌小孩子说话咕咕哝哝的.

sentences.en: How can you abide such a person?
sentences.cn: 你怎么能屈从于这样的人?

sentences.en: I can't abide people who can't make up their minds.
sentences.cn: 我受不了优柔寡断的人。

sentences.en: I can't abide people with no sense of humour.
sentences.cn: 我讨厌和没有幽默感的人打交道。

sentences.en: I can’t abide that man – he’s so self-satisfied.
sentences.cn: 我受不了那个人，他太自满了。

sentences.en: If you join the club, you have to abide by its rules.
sentences.cn: 如果你参加俱乐部, 你就得遵守它的规章.

sentences.en: Miss Furniss could not abide sloppiness.
sentences.cn: 弗尼斯小姐受不了马马虎虎的作风。

sentences.en: Regardless of whether he is right or wrong, we have to abide by his decisions.
sentences.cn: 不管他正确与否，我们都得服从他的决定。

sentences.en: She can't abide his rudeness.
sentences.cn: 她不能忍受他的粗鲁行为.

sentences.en: She can't abide that man.
sentences.cn: 她不能忍受那个人。

sentences.en: She couldn't abide his success.
sentences.cn: 她见不得他成功。

sentences.en: She'll abide her time.
sentences.cn: 她将等待时机.

sentences.en: They have got to abide by the rules.
sentences.cn: 他们必须遵守规则。

sentences.en: We are not free agents; we abide by the decisions of our president.
sentences.cn: 我们不能自主行事；我们遵循总统的决定。

sentences.en: You must abide by the results of your mistakes.
sentences.cn: 你必须承担你的错误所造成的后果.

sentences.en: You must abide by what you have said.
sentences.cn: 你说话要算数.

sentences.en: You'll have to abide by the rules of the club.
sentences.cn: 你必须遵守俱乐部的规定。

words.tran_cn: 遵守；容忍；继续存在（abide的现在分词）
遵守；停留；忍受（abide的过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: 容忍，逗留，居住，遵守，遵照（规则、决定、劝告等）
